sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SCIIŒNOBATES (from the Greek, σχοιvος, a rope, and βαιvω, I walk), a name which the Greeks gave to their rope-dancers. By the Romans they were called funambuli. The schœnobates were slaves whose masters made money of them, by entertaining the people with their feats of activity. Mercurialis (De Arte Gymnastica, lib. iii.) gives us five figures of schœnobates, engraven after ancient stones.
